abstract: <jats:p>The taxonomy of the<jats:italic>Caryocolum tricolorella</jats:italic>species complex, an informal subsection of the diverse<jats:italic>Caryocolum interalbicella</jats:italic>species group, is revised and four species are separated from DNA barcodes of the mitochondrial COI (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 1) gene and adult morphology:<jats:italic>C. tricolorella</jats:italic>(Haworth, 1812),<jats:italic>C. fibigerium</jats:italic>Huemer, 1988,<jats:italic>C. herwigvanstaai</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, and<jats:italic>C. olekarsholti</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>These species show a vicariant distribution pattern, with<jats:italic>C. tricolorella</jats:italic>widely distributed in Central and Northern Europe,<jats:italic>C. fibigerium</jats:italic>restricted to the Iberian Peninsula and southern France,<jats:italic>C. herwigvanstaai</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>to the Italian Peninsula, and<jats:italic>C. olekarsholti</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>to the Balkans. All species are described in detail, and the adults and genitalia of both sexes are illustrated.</jats:p>
title: ﻿Underestimated cryptic diversity in the Caryocolum tricolorella species complex (Lepidoptera, Gelechiidae)
